definition: to do as promised/to be as good as one's word/to honor one's word/to mean what one says
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
variant of 說|说[shuo1]
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
old variant of 話|话[hua4]
to regard as/to figure/to calculate/to compute
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
old variant of 話|话[hua4]

sentences.english: We know what the rich man says.
sentences.chinese: 那个富人总是说话算话。

sentences.english: In friendship, your word as your honor is a given.
sentences.chinese: 在友谊里，你说话算话就会有好声誉。

sentences.english: I don't understand why my boyfriend finds it so hard to keep his word.
sentences.chinese: 我不懂为何我的男友会觉得说话算话那么难。

sentences.english: We know that she is believable, so we trust her.
sentences.chinese: 我们知道她一向说话算话，所以我们信任她。

sentences.english: My friends, God keeps His word.
sentences.chinese: 亲爱的朋友，神说话算话。

sentences.english: I guess she meant what she said. They're just doing a random search.
sentences.chinese: 我猜她说话算话，他们只是在做一项抽查而已。

sentences.english: I am a man of my word so what do you want of mine?
sentences.chinese: 我说话算话，你想要我的什么东西？

sentences.english: What the rich man says is always taken seriously.
sentences.chinese: 那个富人总是说话算话。

sentences.english: He will show them that he is true to his words.
sentences.chinese: 他将让他们看到，他是说话算话的。

definition: to keep one's promise/to mean what one says
to be as good as one's word (idiom)/to keep one's promise
lit. to eat one's words/to break a promise/to go back on one's word/to renege/unsworn testimony
promises must be kept
a nobleman's word is his bond (proverb)
pinyin: jun1 zi3 yi1 yan2 , si4 ma3 nan2 zhui1

definition: (of sb's words) to count/can be trusted
(idiom) it's a deal/that's settled then
lit. to grow fat eating one's words (idiom)/fig. not to live up to one's promises
one word worth nine sacred tripods (idiom); words of enormous weight
lit. once said, a team of horses cannot unsay it (idiom); a promise must be kept
pinyin: yi1 yan2 ji4 chu1 , si4 ma3 nan2 zhui1

definition: let's talk about the unpleasant things first/let's be frank
pinyin: chou3 hua4 shuo1 zai4 qian2 tou5

definition: to go back on one's word/to break one's promise/to be unfaithful/to be untrustworthy
not to be repeated/not to be taken as a precedent/just this once
The honest person does nothing underhand (idiom)./fig. Do what you want to do openly and without dissimulation.
pinyin: ming2 ren2 bu4 zuo4 an4 shi4

definition: lit. if you agree to bet you must accept to lose/fig. you bet, you pay
to agree on/to settle on
